physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 59-year-old woman, body mass index of 35, presented with right breast ductal carcinoma in situ; underwent reconstruction with latissimus dorsi myocutaneous flap and implant.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Eight months after laparoscopic gastric banding, her body mass index decreased to 30, leading to a 'double-bubble' deformity of the right reconstructed breast, Baker grade 2 capsule, and native tissue volume loss.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 45-year-old woman with a maximum body mass index of 48, current body mass index of 29, and substantial abdominal skin laxity and breast deflation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Operated six months after bilateral free TRAM flap reconstruction, she presented with substantial breast skin laxity and underwent further surgical revision due to progressive flatness of reconstructions.
